title: Install the game on my Windows PC
description: As a Windows PC gamer, I want to run a simple, guided installer for Monopoly Tycoon, so that I can get the game set up on my computer quickly and without errors, and start playing right away.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have downloaded the standalone installer executable for Monopoly Tycoon on a Windows PC with sufficient disk space and administrative rights, When I run the installer and accept all default options, Then The installer copies all game files to the default program files directory, a progress bar is shown, and a completion screen appears.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have started the installer on a machine where the target drive has less than the required 2 GB of free space, When I click the 'Install' button, Then The installer must display a user-friendly error message stating that there is insufficient disk space and halt the installation.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am logged into a standard Windows user account without administrative privileges, When I run the installer executable, Then The Windows User Account Control (UAC) prompt must appear, requesting elevation to administrative privileges.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing on all target platforms. Inno Setup script is peer-reviewed and merged. The final installer executable is a single, digitally signed file. The installed game launches and is playable. The uninstaller is verified to work correctly.

title: Choose a custom installation directory
description: As a Windows PC user installing the game, I want to be able to choose a custom installation directory so that I can manage my disk space and organize my installed applications according to my personal preferences.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is running the game installer and has reached the 'Choose Install Location' screen, When the user clicks the 'Browse...' button, selects a valid directory on a different drive (e.g., 'D:\Games'), and proceeds with the installation, Then the installer successfully installs all game files into the 'D:\Games\MonopolyTycoon' directory.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, When the user views the screen or selects a different drive, Then the UI accurately displays the total disk space required for the game and the available disk space on the currently selected drive, updating dynamically when the drive is changed.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, When the user selects a directory on a drive where the available space is less than the required space, Then the installer displays a clear error message stating 'Insufficient disk space' and the 'Install' button is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Inno Setup script changes are peer-reviewed. Manual E2E testing of all scenarios has been completed and passed. The installer package has been rebuilt with the updated logic.

title: Provide an option to create a desktop shortcut during installation
description: As a new player installing the game, I want to see a checkbox option to create a desktop shortcut during the installation process, so that I can easily find and launch the game directly from my desktop after it's installed.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is running the game installer, When the user navigates to the 'Select Additional Tasks' screen and sees the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option is checked by default and proceeds, Then a shortcut named 'Monopoly Tycoon' is created on the user's desktop.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a desktop shortcut was created via the installer, When the user inspects the shortcut's properties, Then the shortcut displays the official game icon and its target path correctly points to the game's primary executable.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a desktop shortcut was created via the installer, When the user double-clicks the desktop shortcut, Then the Monopoly Tycoon game application launches successfully.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Inno Setup script changes are peer-reviewed. The final installer package is available and verified. E2E tests for shortcut creation, validation, and launch are successful.

title: Receive guidance on locating log files after an error
description: As a player who has encountered an unexpected game crash, I want to be shown a clear error message that includes a unique error ID and instructions on where to find the log files, so that I can easily provide developers with the necessary information to diagnose and fix the bug.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is running and an unhandled exception occurs, When the global exception handler catches the exception, Then a modal error dialog is displayed, blocking interaction with the game window.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the error dialog is displayed, When the user views the dialog content, Then the dialog contains a non-technical message, a unique Error ID, and the full, absolute path to the user's log directory.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an unhandled exception has been caught and an Error ID is displayed to the user, When the exception is processed by the logging system, Then a log entry at the 'ERROR' level is written to the log file, containing the full exception details and the exact same Error ID shown in the dialog.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Code for the global exception handler is peer-reviewed. Manual testing confirms the end-to-end flow from crash to log file verification. No PII leaks have been identified in the logged exception data.

title: Uninstall the game cleanly from my computer
description: As a Windows PC user who no longer wishes to keep the game installed, I want a standard and thorough uninstallation process so that I can completely remove all application files and reclaim my disk space, ensuring my system remains clean.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is successfully installed on a Windows machine, When the user navigates to 'Apps & features', selects 'Monopoly Tycoon', and clicks 'Uninstall', Then the uninstallation wizard is launched and completes successfully.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user has completed the uninstallation, When they check the system, Then the main installation directory, desktop shortcut, and Start Menu folder are all deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Monopoly Tycoon game application is currently running, When the user attempts to launch the uninstaller, Then the uninstaller displays a clear error message stating the game must be closed before proceeding.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Inno Setup script is peer-reviewed. E2E testing on target Windows versions confirms clean removal of all application files and registry keys. The uninstaller correctly handles the 'keep/remove personal data' choice from US-007.

title: Choose to keep my personal data upon uninstallation
description: As a Windows PC Gamer who needs to uninstall the game, I want to be given a clear choice to keep or delete my personal game data (like save files and player profile) so that I can reinstall the game later without losing all my progress and achievements.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is installed and the user has created personal data in '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon', When the user runs the uninstaller and selects 'No' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, Then the application files are removed, but the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory and all its contents remain untouched.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game is installed and the user has created personal data, When the user runs the uninstaller and selects 'Yes' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, Then the application files AND the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory are also deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is uninstalling and personal data exists, When the uninstaller displays the prompt for data removal, Then the dialog text explicitly mentions 'save games, player profiles, and statistics', and the default selected button is 'No' (to keep data).
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Inno Setup script changes are peer-reviewed. Manual E2E testing of all scenarios has been completed and passed. The uninstaller correctly handles user data according to the user's choice.

title: Start a new game from the main menu
description: As a player, I want to select a 'New Game' option from the main menu so that I can proceed to the game setup screen and configure a new match.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the main menu screen, When the player clicks the 'New Game' button, Then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen, and the main menu screen is no longer visible or interactive.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the main menu screen, When the player uses keyboard navigation to focus on the 'New Game' button and presses the activation key, Then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is on the main menu screen, When the player clicks the 'New Game' button multiple times in quick succession, Then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen only once, without errors.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Code reviewed and approved. Integration testing confirms the transition between Main Menu and Game Setup scenes is successful. The transition animation is smooth and completes correctly.

title: Configure a game with one to three AI opponents
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to select the number of AI opponents from a choice of one, two, or three, so that I can customize the game's challenge, duration, and overall experience to my preference.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the game setup screen, When I select '1' as the number of AI opponents and start the game, Then a new game session is created with a total of two players: one human and one AI.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the game setup screen, When I select '3' as the number of AI opponents and start the game, Then a new game session is created with a total of four players: one human and three AIs.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the game setup screen, When I change the selected number of AI opponents from '1' to '3', Then the UI dynamically updates to display configuration sections for three distinct AI opponents.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing confirms that the selection correctly influences the number of players at game start. The UI correctly displays the corresponding number of AI configuration slots for each selection.

title: Set a unique difficulty level for each AI opponent
description: As a Human Player setting up a new game, I want to independently assign a difficulty level (Easy, Medium, or Hard) to each of my AI opponents so that I can customize the game's challenge to match my skill level and desired experience, enhancing replayability.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the Game Setup screen and have selected 3 AI opponents, When I set the difficulty for 'AI 1' to 'Easy', 'AI 2' to 'Hard', and 'AI 3' to 'Medium', Then the UI must clearly display 'Easy' for AI 1, 'Hard' for AI 2, and 'Medium' for AI 3 respectively.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the Game Setup screen, When I increase the number of AI opponents from 1 to 2, Then a new UI section for 'AI 2' appears, and its difficulty selector defaults to 'Medium'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have configured a game with two AI opponents set to 'Easy' and 'Hard', When I start the game, Then the game loads and the internal PlayerState objects for the two AIs must be initialized with 'ai_difficulty' properties of 'Easy' and 'Hard' respectively.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing confirms that selected difficulties are correctly passed to the game state on start. E2E test confirms AIs are initialized with correct parameters via logs.

title: Create a player profile with a custom name
description: As a new or returning player, I want to create a personal profile by entering a custom name, so that my game progress, historical statistics, and high scores are saved and displayed under my unique identity, enhancing my sense of ownership and achievement.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, When the player enters a valid name (e.g., 'BoardwalkKing') and proceeds with game setup, Then a new player profile is created and persisted with the entered name and a unique internal profile_id.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has successfully created a profile with the name 'CashMoney', When the game starts, Then the human player's name is displayed as 'CashMoney' in the main game HUD.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player is on the game setup screen, When the player enters a name with leading and trailing spaces (e.g., '  RailroadMogul  ') and proceeds, Then the system trims the whitespace, saves the profile name as 'RailroadMogul', and the game setup continues.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing for database persistence completed successfully. E2E flow from name entry to in-game HUD display is verified. Validation rules from US-012 are implemented.

title: Receive feedback for an invalid profile name
description: As a player setting up my profile, I want to receive immediate and clear feedback if the name I enter is invalid, so that I can easily correct it and proceed to start the game without frustration.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, When the player enters a name with fewer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Al'), Then a specific error message 'Name must be at least 3 characters long' is displayed, and the option to proceed is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the game setup screen, When the player enters a name containing special characters (e.g., 'Player!@#'), Then a specific error message 'Name can only contain letters and numbers' is displayed, and the option to proceed is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has entered an invalid name and an error message is displayed, When the player edits the name so that it meets all validation criteria, Then the error message disappears, and the option to proceed becomes enabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for the validation logic implemented with >= 90% coverage. UI updates (error message, button state) are verified to be correct and responsive.

title: View my persistent historical gameplay statistics
description: As a returning player, I want to access a dedicated screen that displays my cumulative gameplay statistics from all my completed games, so that I can track my performance, see my win/loss record, and feel a sense of long-term progression and achievement.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has completed at least one game, When the player selects the 'Player Statistics' option from the main menu, Then a statistics screen is displayed showing correct values for all required metrics (Total games, Wins, W/L Ratio, etc.).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has created a profile but has not completed any games, When the player navigates to the 'Player Statistics' screen, Then the screen displays all statistical categories with appropriate default values (e.g., '0', 'N/A').
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has existing statistics ('Total Games Played' = 5, 'Total Wins' = 2), When the player completes and wins a new game, Then the 'Total Games Played' statistic updates to '6' and 'Total Wins' updates to '3'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing for the game-completion-to-database-update flow is completed. The UI correctly displays data from an empty, partially full, and full database.

title: Select my player token from a set of classic options
description: As a player setting up a new game, I want to choose my game piece from a visual selection of classic tokens, so that I can personalize my in-game identity and feel more connected to the game experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, When the player clicks on an available token (e.g., 'Top Hat'), Then the 'Top Hat' token becomes visually highlighted, and a preview is shown next to the player's name.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has selected a token and configured a game with 3 AI opponents, When the player starts the game, Then the AI opponents are each assigned a unique token from the pool of tokens not selected by the human player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player selected the 'Battleship' token during game setup, When the main game view loads, Then the player's 3D game piece on the board and their icon in the HUD is the 'Battleship'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing confirms the selected token ID is correctly passed to the game state. E2E test confirms correct token appears in-game for human and that all AI tokens are unique.

title: Roll two six-sided dice to start my move
description: As a human player whose turn it is, I want to click a button to roll two virtual dice, so that I can determine the number of spaces my token will move and proceed with my turn.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the human player's turn and they are in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', When the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, Then the system generates two random integers between 1 and 6 inclusive, displays an animation, and the game state transitions to the 'Movement Phase'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given it is an AI player's turn OR the human player is not in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', When the game state is updated, Then the 'Roll Dice' button is visually disabled and non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, When the result of the two dice is identical values (e.g., 3 and 3), Then the system correctly identifies the roll as doubles and sets a flag in the PlayerState object for a potential extra turn.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing with the Game State Manager completed successfully. The 3D dice animation is implemented and visually polished. The randomness of the roll is verified to be cryptographically secure.

title: Watch my token automatically move around the board
description: As a player, I want to see my game token animate its movement from one space to the next after I roll the dice, so that I can visually track my progress around the board and have an immersive, intuitive gameplay experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player's token is on 'St. Charles Place' (index 11) and the game speed is 'Normal', When the player rolls a total of 5, Then the token animates moving sequentially across 5 spaces, landing on 'Indiana Avenue' (index 16).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player's token is on 'Park Place' (index 37), When the player rolls a total of 6, Then the token animates moving sequentially, clearly passing over the 'GO' space, before landing on 'Reading Railroad' (index 5).
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's turn results in them being sent to Jail, When the game logic directs the player to Jail, Then the token does not animate space-by-space but instead plays a special, direct animation to the 'In Jail' section of the board.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Animation and camera movement are reviewed and approved for smoothness. Performance requirements are verified on target hardware. Animation speed correctly adjusts based on game settings.

title: Receive an extra turn after rolling doubles
description: As a player (human or AI), I want to be granted an immediate, additional turn after I roll doubles, so that the game correctly follows the official Monopoly rules and provides an authentic gameplay experience.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is a player's turn and their consecutive doubles count is 0, When the player rolls doubles, Then they move, complete their action, the game state confirms it is still their turn, and their doubles count becomes 1.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has just rolled doubles, When they roll again and the result is not a double, Then they move, complete their action, their doubles count is reset to 0, and the turn passes to the next player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, When they roll doubles to get out, Then they move, complete their action, and their turn ends; they are NOT granted an extra turn.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing completed for the full turn sequence, including the critical 'get out of jail' exception. UI feedback for the extra turn is implemented and reviewed.

title: Be sent to jail for rolling three consecutive doubles
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically send my token to jail if I roll three consecutive doubles in a single turn, so that the game correctly enforces the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is taking their turn and has already rolled doubles twice in a row, When the player rolls the dice for a third time and the result is doubles, Then the player's token is immediately moved directly to the 'In Jail' space and their turn ends.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has rolled doubles twice and is on a space near GO, When the player rolls their third consecutive double, Then their token is sent directly to Jail and does not collect the $200 GO salary.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has rolled doubles once or twice consecutively, When their next roll in the same turn is not doubles, Then the player moves normally, their turn ends, and their consecutive doubles counter is reset to zero.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing completed successfully, verifying the interaction between the dice roller, turn manager, and player state. UI notifications and audio/visual cues are implemented and approved.

title: Collect $200 salary when passing or landing on GO
description: As a Player, I want my cash balance to be automatically credited with a $200 salary when my token passes over or lands on the GO space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player's token is on 'Boardwalk' (space 39) with $500 cash, When the player rolls a 5, causing them to pass GO and land on 'Baltic Avenue', Then their cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player's token is on 'Park Place' (space 37) with $500 cash, When the player rolls a 3, causing them to land exactly on 'GO', Then their cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's token is on a Chance space, When they draw a card that reads 'Go to Jail. Go directly to Jail. Do not pass GO. Do not collect $200.', Then their token moves to Jail and their cash balance remains unchanged.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests cover all scenarios (pass, land, no pass, go to jail). Integration testing completed to verify PlayerState is correctly updated within the game loop. UI feedback is implemented and reviewed.

title: Get out of jail by paying the $50 fine
description: As a player who is in jail, I want to be presented with the option to pay a $50 fine at the beginning of my turn, so that I can immediately get out of jail and continue my turn normally.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with a cash balance of $1500, When I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, Then my cash balance is reduced to $1450, my player status is updated to 'Active', and I proceed to the Pre-Roll Management phase of my turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with a cash balance of $49, When the game presents the 'Get Out of Jail' options, Then the 'Pay $50 Fine' option is visually disabled and non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with exactly $50 cash, When I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, Then my cash balance is reduced to $0, my status becomes 'Active', and I proceed with my turn.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing completed for the UI-to-GameState flow. Unit tests cover payment logic including sufficient, exact, and insufficient funds.

title: Get out of jail by using a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card
description: As a player who is in jail and owns a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, I want to be presented with the option to use it at the start of my turn, so that I can get out of jail immediately without spending money.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player's status is 'InJail' and their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 1, When the player selects 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card', Then their status is updated to 'Active', their card count becomes 0, and they proceed with a normal turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player uses a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card from the Chance deck, When the action is confirmed, Then the card is placed at the bottom of the Chance card deck.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player's status is 'InJail' and their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 0, When their turn begins, Then the UI option to 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card' is not displayed or is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing for the full action (UI click -> state update -> turn progression) completed successfully. The card is correctly returned to the bottom of the appropriate deck.

title: Attempt to get out of jail by rolling for doubles
description: As a player in jail, I want to choose the option to roll the dice on my turn, so that I can attempt to get out of jail for free by rolling doubles.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in Jail and it is my turn, When I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and my roll is doubles, Then my player status is updated to 'Active', my token moves the number of spaces on the dice, and my turn ends (no extra turn).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in Jail and it is my turn on the 1st or 2nd attempt, When I select 'Roll for Doubles' and my roll is not doubles, Then my 'jail_turns_remaining' is decremented by 1 and my turn immediately ends.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is the start of my turn and I am in jail, When the pre-roll phase begins, Then a modal UI dialog is presented with my available options, including a 'Roll for Doubles' button.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The special rule for 'no extra turn on doubles' is explicitly tested and verified. Unit tests cover all state transitions for success and failure on each of the three turns.

title: Be forced to pay the fine after failing to roll doubles for 3 turns in jail
description: As a player in jail for my third consecutive turn, I want the game to automatically force me to pay the $50 fine if I fail to roll doubles, so that the official game rules are enforced.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in Jail, their 'jail_turns_remaining' is 1, and they have >$50 cash, When they roll the dice and the result is not doubles, Then their cash is reduced by $50, their status changes to 'Active', and their token moves forward.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is in Jail and their 'jail_turns_remaining' is 1, When they roll and the result is doubles, Then their cash is not changed, their status becomes 'Active', and their token moves forward.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is in Jail, their 'jail_turns_remaining' is 1, and they have <$50 cash, When they roll and the result is not doubles, Then the game prompts them to raise funds by mortgaging/selling, and if they fail, the bankruptcy process is initiated.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing with the bankruptcy and asset management systems completed successfully. UI feedback for the transaction is implemented and reviewed.

title: Draw a Chance card when landing on a Chance space
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Chance card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Chance space, so that the game follows the official rules and introduces an element of luck.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player lands on a Chance space and the top card is 'Bank pays you dividend of $50', When the card is drawn, Then a UI element displays the card, the player's cash increases by $50, and the card is placed at the bottom of the deck.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player lands on a Chance space, When they draw the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, Then the card is displayed, their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count becomes 1, and the card is removed from the deck cycle until used.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player lands on a Chance space, When they draw the 'Go to Jail' card, Then their token moves directly to Jail, their status is set to 'InJail', they do not collect $200, and their turn ends.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. All 16 standard Chance cards are implemented and tested. Card data is successfully loaded from an external JSON file. Integration testing is completed for the full land->draw->execute->update state cycle.

title: Draw a Community Chest card when landing on a Community Chest space
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Community Chest card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Community Chest space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player lands on Community Chest, When they draw a card instructing them to collect money, Then the player's cash balance is increased by the specified amount.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player lands on Community Chest, When they draw the 'Go to Jail' card, Then their token is moved directly to Jail and their turn ends.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player lands on Community Chest, When they draw the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, Then their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is incremented by one and the card is removed from the deck until used.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. All 16 standard Community Chest cards are implemented and tested. Card data is successfully loaded from an external JSON file. The Command Pattern is used for extensible card actions.

title: Choose to pay $200 or 10% of my net worth for Income Tax
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear choice between paying a flat $200 or 10% of my total net worth when I land on the Income Tax space, so that I can make the most strategic financial decision.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player lands on 'Income Tax', When their movement phase concludes, Then the game pauses and a modal dialog is displayed with two payment options.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has $500 cash and $1500 in assets (Net Worth = $2000), When the Income Tax dialog is displayed, Then it presents choices for '$200' and '10% ($200)'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has $100 cash and a net worth of $1500, When they select either the '$200' or '$150' option, Then the game initiates the asset liquidation flow, requiring the player to mortgage/sell to cover the debt.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for the NetWorthCalculator service achieve minimum of 80% coverage. Integration tests covering the choice-to-payment and choice-to-bankruptcy-flow scenarios are implemented and passing.

title: Pay a fixed Luxury Tax amount
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically deduct the fixed Luxury Tax amount from my cash when I land on that space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player has cash greater than the Luxury Tax amount, When their token lands on the 'Luxury Tax' space, Then the fixed tax amount is automatically deducted from their cash balance.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has insufficient cash to pay the Luxury Tax, When their token lands on the 'Luxury Tax' space, Then the player is prompted to manage their assets to pay the debt, or is declared bankrupt if they cannot.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player pays the Luxury Tax, When the transaction completes, Then it is logged at the INFO level with turn number, player ID, transaction type ('LuxuryTax'), and amount.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration tests confirm correct interaction with the PlayerState, UI, and Bankruptcy systems. The transaction is correctly logged in the specified structured JSON format.

title: Experience no gameplay effect when landing on Free Parking
description: As a player, I want the game to apply no special action when my token lands on the Free Parking space so that the game adheres to the official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in an active turn and has not rolled doubles, When their token lands on the 'Free Parking' space, Then their cash balance remains unchanged and the game proceeds to the next player's turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is in an active turn and rolls doubles, When their token lands on the 'Free Parking' space, Then their cash balance remains unchanged and the game prompts them to take their extra turn.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player is on a space before GO, When they roll a number that causes them to pass GO and land on 'Free Parking', Then their cash balance first increases by $200 for passing GO, and the landing space has no further effect.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing completed for all scenarios, including the doubles rule interaction. The system correctly enforces the official rule (no house rule money pots).

title: Manage my properties before rolling the dice
description: As a strategic player, I want a dedicated phase at the start of my turn to manage my properties (build, mortgage, trade) before I roll the dice, so that I can proactively adjust my financial position.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is the start of the human player's turn and they are not in jail, When control is transitioned to them, Then the 'Roll Dice' button is enabled, and all property management UI controls are also enabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', When they build a house and then click 'Roll Dice', Then the house is added, cash is deducted, property management controls become disabled, and the game proceeds to the 'Roll Phase'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the player has just completed a turn where they rolled doubles, When the game grants them an extra turn, Then the game returns to the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', allowing them to manage properties again.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for the TurnManager state machine achieve >80% coverage. UI controls are confirmed to be enabled/disabled at the correct times during the turn cycle.

title: Choose to buy an unowned property I land on
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear, informative prompt when I land on an unowned property, giving me the option to purchase it for its listed price, so that I can strategically acquire assets.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have $1000 cash, When my token lands on the unowned 'St. Charles Place' (price $140), Then a modal dialog is displayed with property info and enabled 'Buy' and 'Auction' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the property purchase dialog is displayed, When I click the 'Buy' button, Then my cash is reduced by $140, 'St. Charles Place' is added to my property list, and an ownership marker for me appears on the board space.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have $100 cash, When my token lands on 'St. Charles Place' (price $140), Then the purchase dialog is displayed, but the 'Buy' button is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing for the full land->prompt->buy->update cycle is completed successfully. The transaction logic is verified to be atomic.

title: Choose to send an unowned property to auction instead of buying it
description: As a Human Player, I want the option to decline the immediate purchase of an unowned property I land on so that I can trigger an auction for that property.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have landed on an unowned property I can afford, When the game presents me with the buy/auction dialog, Then both the 'Buy' and 'Auction' buttons are enabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the purchase decision dialog is displayed, When I click the 'Auction' button, Then the dialog closes and the auction process begins, involving all active players.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have landed on an unowned property I cannot afford, When the purchase decision dialog is displayed, Then the 'Buy' button is disabled, but the 'Auction' button remains enabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing with the Auction Manager (US-032) completed successfully. The UI for the decision dialog is reviewed and approved.

title: Participate in an auction for a property
description: As a Human Player, I want to participate in a turn-based auction for an unowned property, placing bids against AI opponents, so that I have a strategic opportunity to acquire properties.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an auction is in progress for 'Boardwalk', When I place a valid winning bid and all other players withdraw, Then the auction UI closes, the final bid amount is deducted from my cash, and I gain ownership of 'Boardwalk'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an auction is in progress and it is my turn to bid, When I select the 'Withdraw' or 'Pass' option, Then my bidding controls are disabled, and the turn passes to the next player in the bidding order.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an auction is in progress, the current high bid is $200, and I have $205 cash, When it is my turn and the minimum next bid is $206, Then the 'Place Bid' button is disabled, leaving 'Withdraw' as my only option.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration tests for the full auction lifecycle (trigger -> bidding -> resolution -> game resume) are implemented and passing. The auction UI has been reviewed for clarity and usability.

title: Build houses on properties in a complete color set
description: As a player who owns a complete color set, I want to purchase and build houses on those properties so that I can increase the rent value and gain a strategic advantage.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own all Light Blue properties (unmortgaged, undeveloped), have >$50 cash, and the bank has houses, When I choose to build one house on Oriental Avenue, Then my cash is reduced by $50, the bank's house count decreases by one, and a house appears on the board.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own Oriental and Vermont Avenues but not Connecticut Avenue, When I view the Light Blue properties in the management screen, Then the option to build houses is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own the complete Light Blue monopoly but have $49 cash, When I attempt to build a house (cost $50), Then the action is blocked with an 'Insufficient Funds' notification.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for the build validation logic in the Rule Engine achieve >70% coverage. Integration testing for the UI-to-GameState-to-UI flow is completed successfully.

title: Enforce even building rule for property development
description: As a player who owns a complete property set, I want the game to enforce the 'even building' rule when I try to purchase or sell houses, so that the game is fair and follows official Monopoly rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a three-property monopoly where Property A has 1 house and Properties B and C have 0 houses, When I attempt to build a second house on Property A, Then the action is blocked, and the UI provides feedback explaining I must build evenly.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly where every property has exactly one house, When I attempt to build a second house on any single property, Then the transaction is successful, and the selected property now has two houses.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a monopoly where Property A has 3 houses and Properties B and C each have 2 houses, When I attempt to sell a house from Property B or C, Then the action is blocked, and the UI indicates I must sell from Property A first.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for the `CanBuildOnProperty` and `CanSellFromProperty` validation logic implemented with >80% coverage. UI feedback and state changes are verified through integration testing.

title: Upgrade a set of 4 houses to a single hotel
description: As a strategic player who has developed a monopoly with four houses on each property, I want to purchase a hotel for each of those properties, so that I can charge the maximum possible rent.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a complete monopoly with 4 houses on each property, sufficient cash, and the Bank has hotels, When I initiate the 'Build Hotel' action, Then my cash is reduced, bank hotel count decreases by 1, bank house count increases by 4, and the property visually updates to 1 hotel.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly with 4 houses on each property, When I attempt to purchase a hotel but the Bank's supply is exhausted, Then the transaction is blocked and a UI notification informs me of the hotel shortage.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a monopoly where one property has 4 houses but another has 3, When I select any property in that set, Then the option to build a hotel is disabled, enforcing the 'even building' rule.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for the RuleEngine's hotel logic implemented with >70% coverage. Integration testing for the UI-to-GameState flow completed successfully.

title: Notify player of building shortage when attempting to build
description: As a player trying to develop my properties, I want to receive a clear notification when I am unable to build because the bank has run out of houses or hotels, so that I understand the game state.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the Property Management screen, When I attempt to purchase a house and the bank's supply of houses is 0, Then the purchase is prevented and a notification appears stating 'Cannot build: No houses available in the bank.'
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the bank's supply of houses is 0, When I view my properties in the Property Management interface, Then the 'Build House' buttons for all eligible properties are visually disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the bank's house supply was 0 and build buttons were disabled, When another player sells houses back to the bank, Then on my next turn, the 'Build House' buttons become enabled again.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing for the UI-to-logic flow is completed successfully. The UI notification and disabled button states are reviewed and approved for clarity.

title: Participate in an auction for the last available buildings
description: As a strategic player, I want to participate in an auction for the last available houses or hotels when there's a building shortage, so that I have a fair, rule-compliant chance to acquire these critical assets.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the Bank has only 2 houses remaining and multiple players wish to build, When my turn begins and I attempt to build, Then a building auction is initiated for the 2 available houses, one at a time.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a building auction is active and it is my turn to bid, When the auction UI is presented, Then it must clearly display the item being auctioned (e.g., '1 House'), the current high bid, and allow me to 'Bid' or 'Pass'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game speed is set to 'Fast' or 'Instant', When a building auction involving me begins, Then the game speed is temporarily set to 'Normal' for the duration of the auction and reverts afterward.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for auction logic and AI bidding stubs implemented. Integration testing for the full auction-to-gameresume cycle completed successfully. UI is implemented as specified and reviewed for usability.

title: Mortgage an undeveloped property to get cash
description: As a player managing my finances, I want to mortgage my undeveloped properties to the Bank, so that I can receive immediate cash to pay debts, fund purchases, or avoid bankruptcy.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am the active player and own an undeveloped, unmortgaged property, When I select the property and confirm the 'Mortgage' action, Then my cash balance increases by the property's mortgage value and the property becomes visually marked as mortgaged.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a property with one or more houses on it, When I select the developed property in the Property Management interface, Then the 'Mortgage' option is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a mortgaged property, When an opponent's token lands on that property, Then no rent transaction occurs.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for the mortgage transaction logic are implemented. Integration testing for the UI-to-GameState flow and rent-collection interaction is completed successfully.

title: Unmortgage a property by paying the principal plus 10% interest
description: As a Human Player managing my assets, I want to pay the bank to unmortgage one of my properties so that I can start collecting rent on it again and enable future development.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a mortgaged property 'St. Charles Place' (mortgage value $70), When I confirm the action to unmortgage it for $77, Then exactly $77 is deducted from my cash and the property's status becomes unmortgaged.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a mortgaged property 'St. Charles Place' (unmortgage cost $77), When I attempt to unmortgage it with only $76 cash, Then the transaction is blocked and the 'Unmortgage' button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have successfully unmortgaged 'St. Charles Place', When I save the game, exit, and then load that save file, Then the property is correctly loaded in its unmortgaged state.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The unmortgage action is correctly persisted through a save/load cycle. The action is correctly logged according to auditability requirements.

title: Initiate a trade with an AI opponent during my turn
description: As a human player, I want to open a trading interface, select an AI opponent, and construct a trade offer involving cash, properties, and cards, so that I can strategically negotiate to acquire properties.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is my turn during the Pre-Roll Management Phase, When I open the trade interface, select an AI, construct an offer, and click 'Propose Trade', Then the proposal is submitted to the AI's decision-making module for evaluation.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a property that has houses on it, When I open the trade interface, Then the developed property is not available for selection in the trade UI.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have $500 cash, When I attempt to enter an amount greater than $500 in the cash offer field, Then the UI prevents the input or caps the value at $500, and the 'Propose Trade' button is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing confirms the UI correctly reflects game state and sends valid offers to the AI module. The UI is keyboard navigable and scales correctly.

title: Respond to a trade offer from an AI opponent
description: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear, interactive dialog when an AI opponent proposes a trade, so that I can evaluate the deal and decide to accept or decline it.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI has initiated a trade proposal, When the system presents the offer to me, Then the game flow is paused, a modal dialog is displayed showing the offered and requested assets, and buttons for 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer' are present.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, When I click the 'Accept' button, Then the system validates the trade, atomically exchanges the assets between me and the AI, and the game flow resumes.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, When I click the 'Decline' button, Then the dialog closes, no assets are exchanged, and the game flow resumes.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for the trade execution logic achieve minimum 70% coverage. The trade dialog UI has been reviewed and approved for clarity and usability.

title: Propose a counter-offer to an AI's trade proposal
description: As a strategic player negotiating with an AI, I want to respond to their trade proposal with a modified counter-offer, so that I can fine-tune the deal to better suit my strategic goals.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI has proposed a trade, When I click the 'Propose Counter-Offer' button, Then the main two-panel trading UI opens, pre-populated with the original offer's assets.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have opened the counter-offer UI and modified the trade, When I submit the counter-offer, Then the AI's evaluation logic is triggered, it responds with accept or decline, a notification is shown, and assets are exchanged only if accepted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have clicked 'Propose Counter-Offer', When I click the 'Cancel' button within the trading UI, Then the UI closes, the original offer is considered declined, and the game returns to its prior state.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing for the full counter-offer workflow is completed successfully. The UI correctly transitions into an editable state while preserving the initial offer.

title: Receive a non-intrusive notification when AI players trade with each other
description: As a human player, I want to see a non-intrusive notification when a trade is completed between two AI opponents, so that I can maintain situational awareness of the game's strategic landscape.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress with at least two AI opponents, When 'AI 1' successfully completes a trade with 'AI 2', Then a notification banner appears on screen with a summary (e.g., 'Trade Complete: AI 1 traded 2 properties to AI 2 for $200').
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an AI-to-AI trade is completed, When the notification is shown, Then the game flow is not interrupted or paused by the notification, and it disappears automatically after a few seconds.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given 'AI 1' proposes a trade to 'AI 2' and the offer is rejected, When the negotiation fails, Then no trade notification is displayed to the human player.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing confirms the event is correctly handled from AI trade completion to UI display. The notification functions correctly across all game speeds and supported resolutions.

title: Automatically collect rent when an opponent lands on my property
description: As a property owner, I want the game to automatically calculate and transfer the correct rent from an opponent who lands on my property so that the game rules are enforced fairly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given Player A owns 'Baltic Avenue' (unmortgaged, undeveloped), When Player B lands on 'Baltic Avenue', Then the base rent is automatically transferred from Player B to Player A.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given Player A owns the magenta monopoly (undeveloped, unmortgaged), When Player B lands on 'Virginia Avenue', Then double the base rent is transferred from Player B to Player A.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given Player A owns 'Indiana Avenue' and it is currently mortgaged, When Player B lands on 'Indiana Avenue', Then no rent is collected.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit test coverage for the rent calculation module exceeds 85%. Integration test confirms the flow from landing to cash transfer and HUD update. The trigger for the bankruptcy module is tested.

title: Automatically pay rent when I land on an opponent's property
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically calculate and process my rent payment when I land on an opponent's property, so that the game flows smoothly and the rules are enforced correctly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on an opponent's property with houses and can afford the rent, When my movement ends, Then my cash is automatically reduced by the correct rent amount, the opponent's cash increases, and a notification confirms the payment.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I land on an opponent's mortgaged property, When my movement ends, Then no rent is charged, my cash remains unchanged, and a notification indicates no rent is due.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have insufficient cash to pay the rent, When the payment is triggered, Then the system identifies I cannot pay and initiates the bankruptcy process.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for the rent calculation logic cover all property types and rule variations. Integration testing confirms the correct interaction between movement, rent payment, UI updates, and the bankruptcy trigger.

title: See a victory screen when I am the last player remaining
description: As a human player who has won the game, I want to be presented with a distinct and celebratory victory screen, so that my achievement is acknowledged and I feel a sense of accomplishment.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress, When the last AI opponent is declared bankrupt, making the human player the sole winner, Then the main game view is replaced by a modal Victory Screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, When the player views the screen, Then it must display a 'Victory!' message, the player's profile name, Final Net Worth, Game Duration, and Total Turns from the match.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, When the screen first appears, Then a victory fanfare audio clip plays and celebratory visual effects (e.g., confetti) are rendered.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing for the bankruptcy-to-victory-screen flow is completed successfully. Performance on recommended hardware is verified. Visual and audio assets are implemented and linked to the theme system.

title: See a game-over screen when I go bankrupt
description: As a human player, I want to be shown a clear 'Game Over' screen immediately after I am declared bankrupt, so that I understand I have lost the game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the human player incurs a debt they cannot pay after liquidating all assets, When the system declares them bankrupt, Then the main game view is immediately replaced by a modal 'Game Over' screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is viewing the 'Game Over' screen, When they click the 'View Game Summary' button, Then a high-speed simulation of the remaining AI players' turns begins until a single AI winner is determined.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the high-speed AI simulation is running, When the simulation concludes with a single AI winner, Then the game automatically transitions to the final 'Game Summary' screen.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The high-speed AI simulation is verified to complete correctly and without performance degradation. The UI/UX for the 'Game Over' screen and simulation indicator has been reviewed and approved.

title: View a detailed game summary screen after a match ends
description: As a Human Player who has just completed a game, I want to be shown a detailed game summary screen so that I can review the performance of all players and understand the final outcome.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game has concluded with a human win, When the Game Summary screen is displayed, Then a 'Victory!' message is shown, the human player is highlighted as the winner, and stats are shown for all players.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a game has concluded with a human loss, When the Game Summary screen is displayed, Then a 'Game Over' message is shown, the final winning AI is highlighted, and stats are shown for all players.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Game Summary screen is displayed, When the user reviews the stats, Then the values for 'Final Net Worth', 'Total Rent Collected', and 'Properties Owned' must accurately reflect the final state of the game.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing for the game-end-to-summary-screen flow is completed successfully. The UI is reviewed and approved for all player counts (2-4). The high-speed AI simulation from US-047 correctly leads to this screen.

title: View at-a-glance information for all players in the HUD
description: As a player, I want a persistent on-screen display showing the name, token, and current cash for every player, so that I can instantly assess the financial standing of my opponents and myself.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a new 4-player game has started, When the main game board scene is loaded, Then a persistent HUD is visible with four panels, each correctly displaying the player's name, token icon, and starting cash of $1500.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a game is in progress and it is Player 1's turn, When the player views the game screen, Then Player 1's panel in the HUD has a distinct visual highlight.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has a cash balance of $1000 displayed in the HUD, When the player passes GO and collects a $200 salary, Then the player's cash display in the HUD immediately updates to show $1200.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing confirms HUD updates from game events. The HUD layout is confirmed to work on all target aspect ratios.

title: See clear visual indicators of property ownership on the board
description: As a player, I want clear, player-specific visual indicators on each property space on the board so that I can instantly understand who owns what, identify monopolies, and make faster strategic decisions.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a property on the board is unowned, When a player purchases that property, Then a visual indicator corresponding to the purchasing player's unique color/token immediately appears on the property space.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player owns a property, When the player mortgages that property, Then the ownership indicator's visual state changes to clearly signify it is mortgaged (e.g., becomes greyed-out) while still being identifiable.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given Player A owns Property X and Player B owns Property Y, When they complete a trade exchanging ownership, Then the marker on Property X immediately updates to Player B's ownership, and the marker on Property Y updates to Player A's ownership.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing completed for all trigger events (purchase, trade, mortgage, bankruptcy). Performance requirements verified under a fully populated board scenario. Accessibility requirement for non-color-based indicators is met.

title: Interact with modal dialogs for critical decisions
description: As a human player, I want the game to pause and display a focused, interactive pop-up for critical decisions, so that I can consciously evaluate my options without the risk of missing important game events.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am the human player, When I land on an unowned property, Then the game pauses and a modal dialog is displayed showing the property's info with 'Buy' and 'Auction' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an AI opponent has proposed a trade, When the offer is presented to me, Then the game pauses and a modal dialog displays the offered/requested assets with 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given any critical decision modal dialog is active on screen, When I attempt to click on any UI element outside of the dialog, Then the clicks are ignored, and only interactions inside the modal are registered.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. A reusable modal dialog prefab and controller have been created. The modal system is successfully integrated for property purchase, trade response, and income tax scenarios. The UI has been reviewed for visual polish and usability.

title: Access a dedicated interface to manage all my properties
description: As a human player managing my assets, I want to access a dedicated property management screen so that I can efficiently view my properties and take strategic actions like building or mortgaging from a single interface.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is my turn, before I have rolled the dice, When I click the 'Manage Properties' button in the main HUD, Then a dedicated property management screen is displayed, overlaying the main game board.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a complete, undeveloped monopoly and have sufficient cash, When I select a property from that monopoly and click the 'Build House' button, Then my cash is debited by the correct building cost and the UI updates immediately.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own a monopoly where one property has 1 house and the others have 0, When I select the property that already has 1 house, Then the 'Build House' button for that property is disabled, and a tooltip explains that building must be even.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit test coverage for UI logic and state validation meets the project standard. Integration tests for all property management actions are implemented and passing. The UI has been reviewed and approved by a UX/UI designer.

title: Use a two-panel interface to build and review trade offers
description: As a Human Player, I want a clear, two-panel trading interface that displays my items and the opponent's items side-by-side so that I can easily construct, review, and understand trade offers.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is my turn, When I select an AI opponent and choose to 'Trade', Then a modal interface appears with two panels: 'Your Offer' and 'Their Offer', showing available assets for selection.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trading interface is open, When I add my property and cash to 'Your Offer' and add an AI's property to 'Their Offer', Then all selected items appear in their respective panels, and the 'Propose Trade' button becomes enabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an AI opponent initiates a trade with me, When the offer is presented, Then the same two-panel interface appears, pre-populated with the AI's offer, and displays 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer' buttons.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The trading UI has been manually tested for all scenarios, including error conditions and edge cases. The UI has been reviewed by a UX/UI designer and approved. All UI elements are functional across all supported resolutions.

title: Access an in-game settings menu
description: As a player in the middle of a game, I want to access a settings menu without quitting the match, so that I can adjust game options, save my progress, or exit the game in a controlled manner.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress and it is my turn, When I press the 'Escape' key, Then a settings menu overlay appears and the game simulation is paused.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the settings menu is open, When I press the 'Escape' key again or click the 'Resume Game' button, Then the menu is closed and the game simulation resumes from its exact previous state.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the in-game settings menu is open, When I view the menu, Then it must contain distinct, clickable options for 'Resume Game', 'Settings', 'Save Game', 'Load Game', 'Return to Main Menu', and 'Quit to Desktop'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Unit tests for the pause/resume logic are implemented with >80% coverage. Integration testing for opening/closing the menu in various game states is completed successfully. This story is a blocker for numerous other settings-related stories.

title: Adjust the game speed to make animations faster or instant
description: As an experienced player, I want to change the game speed setting so that I can reduce waiting times for animations and AI decisions, allowing for a faster-paced game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in a game, When I navigate to the settings menu and select the 'Fast' game speed option, Then all subsequent game animations play at an accelerated rate and AI decision delays are reduced.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in a game, When I navigate to the settings menu and select the 'Instant' game speed option, Then all subsequent game animations are skipped or rendered almost instantaneously, and AI decisions have no artificial delay.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game speed is set to 'Fast' or 'Instant' and I am involved in a property auction, When the auction begins, Then the game speed is automatically and temporarily set to 'Normal' for the duration of the auction.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Manual E2E testing confirms a smooth and consistent experience on all speed settings. The auction override logic is tested and verified. The setting is correctly saved and loaded with a game file.

title: Adjust master, music, and sound effect volumes independently
description: As a player, I want to independently adjust the master, music, and sound effect volume levels so that I can customize the game's audio to my personal preference.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the settings menu and background music is playing, When I move the 'Music' volume slider, Then the volume of the background music changes in real-time to match the slider's value.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the settings menu, When I move the 'Sound Effects' volume slider, Then a sample sound effect is played at the new volume level, and the new setting is immediately persisted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have set the Music volume to 30%, When I close the game completely and then relaunch it, Then the game's music volume is at 30% and the slider in the settings menu reflects this saved value.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing confirms UI sliders correctly manipulate the audio mixer. All existing game audio sources have been audited and correctly routed to the Music or SFX channel. Settings persist between sessions.

title: Reset all my historical statistics and high scores
description: As a Data-Conscious Player, I want an option in the settings menu to permanently delete all my historical gameplay statistics and high scores after a confirmation prompt, so that I can have a clean slate.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have existing historical statistics, When I navigate to settings, click 'Reset All Player Data', and click 'Confirm' on the dialog, Then all my historical stats are reset to their default zero state, and my high scores list is empty.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have existing stats, When I click 'Reset All Player Data' and then click 'Cancel' on the confirmation dialog, Then no data is modified or deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am in the settings menu, When I click the 'Reset All Player Data' button, Then a modal confirmation dialog appears with text clearly stating the action is permanent and cannot be undone.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing completed to verify database transaction integrity. The UI for the button and dialog has been reviewed for clarity and usability. The feature works correctly for a profile with no pre-existing data.

title: Provide a bulk deletion option for all saved games via the settings menu
description: As a user who wants to manage my game data, I want an option in the settings menu to delete all my saved games at once, with a confirmation step, so that I can easily clear out old progress.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have at least one saved game file, When I click 'Delete All Saved Games' in settings and 'Confirm' on the dialog, Then all files within the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/saves' directory are permanently deleted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have opened the deletion confirmation dialog, When I click the 'Cancel' button, Then the dialog closes and no files are deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have no saved game files, When I navigate to the settings menu, Then the 'Delete All Saved Games' button is visibly disabled and cannot be clicked.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Error handling for file system exceptions is implemented and verified. The UI for the button and dialog has been reviewed and approved for clarity.

title: Start an optional interactive tutorial to learn the game
description: As a new player, I want to start an optional, interactive tutorial so that I can learn the basic rules and game controls in a guided, hands-on environment before playing a full game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the tutorial has started, When it prompts me to roll the dice by highlighting the 'Roll' button, Then all other UI elements are non-interactive, and the dice animate a pre-determined roll result.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given my token has landed on an unowned property as part of the script, When the purchase dialog appears, Then the tutorial highlights the 'Buy' button with an explanatory overlay, and clicking it deducts the cost and grants ownership.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have completed the final guided action, When the final action is confirmed, Then a 'Tutorial Complete' dialog is displayed with options to 'Start New Game' or 'Return to Main Menu'.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. A full, successful manual end-to-end test of the tutorial has been completed. The tutorial script is data-driven, not hardcoded. The user can exit the tutorial cleanly at any step.

title: Access and search a digital rulebook from game menus
description: As a player, I want to open a searchable digital rulebook from both the main menu and the in-game pause menu so that I can quickly find and clarify specific game rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the rulebook UI is open, When I type a keyword (e.g., 'mortgage') into the search bar, Then the list of rules is dynamically filtered to show only entries containing 'mortgage', and the keyword is highlighted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have opened the rulebook from the in-game pause menu, When I click the 'Close' button or press 'Escape', Then the rulebook UI closes and I am returned to the pause menu, with the game remaining paused.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the rulebook's source JSON file is missing or malformed, When I attempt to open the rulebook, Then a user-friendly error message is displayed, the UI does not open, and an ERROR is written to the log file.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Performance requirements for search speed and UI loading are verified. Error handling for missing/corrupt data file is confirmed to work. Rulebook content is loaded from an external file.

title: Save game progress into one of several save slots
description: As a player, I want to save my current game progress into a specific save slot at the start of my turn, so that I can safely exit the game and resume playing from the same point at a later time.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given it is my turn, before I have rolled the dice, When I open the pause menu, select 'Save Game', and click on an 'Empty' save slot, Then the complete current GameState is serialized into a versioned JSON file in '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/saves'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the 'Save Game' menu and click on a used slot, When a confirmation dialog appears to overwrite the save and I select 'Yes', Then the existing save file is replaced with the new game state data.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is an AI player's turn OR it is my turn but after I have rolled the dice, When I open the pause menu, Then the 'Save Game' button is visually disabled and is not clickable.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. An E2E test of saving and successfully reloading (using US-062 functionality) has been completed. The save operation performance is confirmed to be under the 2-second threshold. The save file includes a version and checksum.

title: Load a game from a previously saved slot
description: As a returning player, I want to select and load a previously saved game from the main menu, so that I can seamlessly continue my progress without having to start over.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the main menu and have a valid saved game, When I navigate to the 'Load Game' screen, select the valid slot, and confirm, Then the game transitions to the gameplay scene, and the entire game state is perfectly restored.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen, When the list of slots is displayed, Then each occupied and valid slot must display the player's profile name, the date and time of the save, and the turn number.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a save file has failed its checksum validation, When the 'Load Game' screen is displayed, Then the slot for the corrupted file is marked as 'Corrupted' or 'Unusable' and is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Performance requirement for load time is verified. All error conditions (corruption, incompatibility, no files) are handled gracefully. A full save-load-verify cycle test with a complex game state is completed successfully.

title: Visually indicate unusable save files on the load game screen
description: As a Returning Player, I want to see a clear, visual indication for any save files that are corrupted or incompatible, so that I can understand which games I can no longer play and avoid loading a broken save.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a save file exists whose content does not match its stored checksum, When the player navigates to the 'Load Game' screen, Then the entry for that slot is visually distinct (e.g., greyed out) and clearly labeled as 'Corrupted'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a save slot is marked as 'Corrupted', When the player hovers the mouse cursor over it, Then a tooltip appears with an informative message, such as 'This save file is corrupted and cannot be loaded.'
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a valid save file exists that was created with an older, incompatible version of the game, When the player navigates to the 'Load Game' screen, Then the entry for that slot is visually distinct and clearly labeled as 'Incompatible Version', and the 'Load' button is disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The application remains stable when presented with malformed or invalid save files. Unit tests for checksum validation and version comparison are implemented. The UI is reviewed for clarity.

title: View a list of my top 10 victories
description: As a competitive player, I want to access a Top 10 High Score screen from the main menu, so that I can review my most successful victories and be motivated to beat my own records.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has won 10 or more games, When they select 'Top Scores' from the main menu, Then a screen is displayed showing a list of exactly 10 entries, sorted by Final Net Worth (descending).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has won 4 games, When they navigate to the 'Top Scores' screen, Then the list displays exactly 4 entries, sorted correctly.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the database contains two victories with the exact same Final Net Worth, but one was achieved in fewer turns, When the player views the 'Top Scores' screen, Then the victory with fewer turns is ranked higher.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Performance requirement of <500ms load time is verified. The feature is successfully tested against an empty, partially full, and full database. Sorting logic for primary and secondary keys is verified.

title: Export my top score history to a text file
description: As a competitive player, I want to export my Top 10 High Scores list to a simple, human-readable text file, so that I can easily share my achievements or keep a personal record.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the 'Top Score History' screen with scores listed, When I click 'Export to Text' and select a location in the Windows 'Save As' dialog, Then a '.txt' file is created at the specified location.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a high score file has been successfully exported, When I open the file, Then it contains a clear header, each score entry is on a new line, and all data fields (Rank, Name, Net Worth, etc.) match the in-game UI.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the high score list is empty, When I view the 'Top Score History' screen, Then the 'Export to Text' button is visibly disabled.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Manual E2E testing of all scenarios (success, cancel, error, empty list) is completed. The exported file format is verified for readability and accuracy.

title: Change the game's visual and audio theme
description: As a player, I want to select and apply different visual and audio themes for the game, so that I can customize my experience and keep the game feeling fresh.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the main menu, When I navigate to Settings, select the 'Futuristic' theme, and confirm, Then the main menu's UI skin, background visuals, and music immediately change to the 'Futuristic' theme assets.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in an active game, When I pause, navigate to Settings, select the 'Futuristic' theme, and resume, Then all in-game assets (board, tokens, UI, music, SFX) are updated to the new theme.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have selected the 'Futuristic' theme and closed the application, When I launch the game again, Then the game starts up with the 'Futuristic' theme already active.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Manual QA has verified both themes are free of visual or audio defects across all game screens and states. Performance requirements for theme switching and memory management are met. The player's theme choice persists correctly.

title: Be notified of available game updates on startup
description: As a Game Player, I want to be notified in a non-intrusive way when a new version of the game is available upon startup, so that I can easily access the latest features and bug fixes.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have an older version of the game and an active internet connection, When I launch the application, Then the game performs a version check asynchronously, and a non-intrusive notification is displayed on the main menu indicating an update is available.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the update notification is displayed, When I click the call-to-action element, Then my default web browser opens to the game's official download page.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I do not have an active internet connection or the version-check endpoint is unreachable, When I launch the application, Then the version check fails silently in the background, no error message is displayed, and the game loads normally.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. Integration testing for network success/failure paths completed successfully using a proxy tool. The UI notification is reviewed for non-intrusiveness. The check is performed over HTTPS.

title: View the game's data privacy statement
description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want to access and read a clear data privacy statement from the main menu, so that I can understand what data the game collects and confirm that it operates entirely offline.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the main menu screen, When I click the 'Privacy Policy' button, Then a modal view appears, displaying the game's data privacy statement.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the privacy statement view is open, When I read the content, Then the text explicitly confirms that the application operates entirely offline and all user data is stored exclusively on the local machine.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the privacy statement view is open, When I click the 'Close' or 'Back' button, Then the view is dismissed, and the main menu becomes interactive again.
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria validated and passing. The final, approved privacy statement text is implemented and sourced from a resource file. The UI is accessible via keyboard/controller and scales correctly on all supported aspect ratios.
